choices.text:
For libreoffice calc write an expression to copy contents from another cell and remove all single quotes
To do that, you can use the following formula in LibreOffice Calc: 
```=IF(LEFT(A1,1)="'",B1,"")```
Assuming your data is stored in cells A1 (original value with double quotes around it), and B1 (newly formatted text without single quotes). The IF function checks if the first character of cell A1 is a single quote. If so, then nothing happens to that row; otherwise, its contents are copied into column B as before.
